#Text=Protect a Convertible
#Text=As a convertible owner , you relish the time spent driving with the top down .
#Text=You may even brave the road on those cooler days , or live in a climate that has hard winters that may eventually put wear on your convertible top .
#Text=Whether it 's hot or cold outside , it 's important to protect your convertible from the elements , and there are several ways to achieve this .
#Text=Begin with proper maintenance , which is the key to keeping your car in good condition , regardless of whether your top is constructed of cloth or vinyl .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Cleaning Convertible Tops
#Text=Wash your convertible regularly .
#Text=It is recommended that you clean your convertible top at least once every 4 weeks to keep dirt from sinking into the fabric or vinyl .
#Text=Wet the top of the convertible with a hose .
#Text=Use a gentle car shampoo or one made specifically for convertible tops , which can be found in any automotive or home improvement store .
#Text=Apply the cleaner with a sponge as you would to the rest of your vehicle .
#Text=Allow the cleaner to sit for 15 minutes for stubborn dirt or stains .
#Text=Scrub the top gently with a bristled brush
#Text=Rinse thoroughly with water. .
#Text=Protecting Cloth Tops
#Text=Begin with a top that is dry and free of dirt and debris .
#Text=Apply a fabric convertible-top protectant .
#Text=Spray the product directly onto the vehicle from a distance of approximately 16-18 inches .
#Text=Allow the top to dry completely .
#Text=Dry thoroughly with a clean , microfiber towel .
#Text=Protecting Vinyl Tops
#Text=Ensure your vinyl top is clean and dry .
#Text=Using sweeping motions , spray a vinyl convertible-top protectant at a distance of 8-12 inches from the top , or spray the product onto a clean , microfiber cloth and wipe the convertible top .
#Text=Wipe the top thoroughly with a fresh cloth until it 's completely dry .
#Text=Repeat this process up to three times if dirt or stains remain .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Avoid washing your convertible in direct sunlight .
#Text=Always wash your convertible top all at once rather than washing in spots , as this will cause certain areas of the top to be discolored .
#Text=If in doubt , determine whether your convertible top is vinyl or fabric by dropping 1/8 tsp . of water on the top and working it into the material .
#Text=If it begins to soak in , the convertible top is most likely made of cloth .
#Text=A vinyl top would allow the drop to pool up and remain .
#Text=A cloth top will also gather small particles such as lint more easily than vinyl will .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Avoid washing your convertible top with common household cleaners such as bleach , which can cause the fabric or vinyl to deteriorate .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Convertible-top cleaner
#Text=Vinyl convertible-top protectant
#Text=Fabric convertible-top protectant
#Text=Microfiber cleaning cloths
